Title: VM - Voter - Review Screen Note Test case - Validating the notes section

Test Steps.Step Action: Login to the TX Dev env - https://dev.sgcivele-onrampdq.civixapps.com/ems-vm-voter-ui/home\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: User must be taken to Voter Management screen\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on "Register New" button from the Quick Access Menu\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: User must be navigated to Voter Registration screen\n

Test Steps.Step Action: On Voter Registration section, Voter Details section, Identification section, Residential Address section  Enter all the mandatory field values \n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Select Political Party field value from the drop down and click Next button\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: User must be navigated to Review Screen\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to the Notes section\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: A text box labelled "Notes" must be displayed to the user\n

Title: 69301 - VM - Participation - Voter Participation Add/Maintain

Test Steps.Step Action: Pre-requisites:\n- Have an existing Active Voter
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Access the EMS system\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Dashboard displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Search\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Search Voter page is displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Use the search criteria to find your existing Voter
Test Steps.Step Expected: Voter found

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Actions" ellipsis next to the existing voter
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "View"
Test Steps.Step Expected: View Voter page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Participation History" tab
Test Steps.Step Expected: Participation History area is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "ADD"
Test Steps.Step Expected:
The Add Participation page is displayed and the following fields are present in this order:

 - Election Date (required field)

 - Election Name (Required field)

 - Party (Primary Only)

 - Method of Request (required dropdown: choices to be Election Day, Absentee, UOCAVA, Vote Center)

 - Request Location (required dropdown: dependent on Method of Request like a specific polling location)

 - Ballot Sent Date (Required)

 - Ballot Received Date (Required)

 - Ballot Return Method (Required dropdown, dependent on method of request)

 - Ballot Status (Required)

 - Ballot Status Reason (required, dropdown dependent on Ballot Status)

 - Checkbox for "Provisional" ballot (optional)

 - If Provisional is checked then the below should display
*Provisional Status (Required)
*Provisional Status Reason (Optional)

 - Comments text box

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "CANCEL"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The user is taken back to the Participation History list and the record is not created

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "ADD"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Add Participation page is displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "CREATE"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The record will not be created and all required fields will show as red

Test Steps.Step Action: Fill in all required fields
Test Steps.Step Expected: Fields filled in

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "CREATE"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The record will be successfully created and the user is taken back to the Participation History list where they can see the new record they just created

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Actions" ellipsis next to the Participation History record you created
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Edit"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Maintain Participation History page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Make any desired change and click "UPDATE"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The record will be updated successfully and you will be able to see the changes reflected in the Participation History list

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Actions" ellipsis next to the Participation History record you just updated\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Delete"
Test Steps.Step Expected: A confirmation box is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Cancel"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The record will not be deleted

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Actions" ellipsis again\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: Options displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Delete"\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: A confirmation box is displayed\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "Ok"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The record will be deleted successfully

Test Steps.Step Action: In the navigation tabs click on "Audit History"
Test Steps.Step Expected:
All Participation History actions will be displayed here:
- Add
- Update
- Delete

Title: EMS - VM - Voter Search

Test Steps.Step Action: Open the application and login as county user and navigate to VM Module
Test Steps.Step Expected: VM home page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the Voter button
Test Steps.Step Expected: Voter Search page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Select the search context: State or County from the County or State Search Selector dropdown.
Test Steps.Step Expected: User can select State or County. If State is selected, the search queries the entire state; if County is selected, it filters by county.

Test Steps.Step Action:
Fill in one or more search fields: 
 - Last Name 
 - First Name 
 - Date of Birth 
 - Driver's License/State ID 
 - SSN 
 - Street No. 
 - Street Name 
 - Apt/Unit No. 
 - City 
 - Zip Code 
 - Voter Status
Test Steps.Step Expected: Fields are filled with appropriate search criteria.

Test Steps.Step Action: Optionally, use wildcard search in any of the fields (e.g., %Jones, Jo%, %DES%).
Test Steps.Step Expected: Wildcard characters are used and partial matches are expected (e.g., %Jones returns "Jones," "Johnson").

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the Search button.
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system processes the search query and displays results based on the entered search criteria.

Test Steps.Step Action: Review the search results displayed in the results grid.
Test Steps.Step Expected:
The following details should be displayed for each voter: 
 - Last Name 
 - First Name 
 - Date of Birth 
 - Street Name 
 - City 
 - Zip Code 
 - Voter Status 
 - County (when logged in as a Region user) 
 - Precinct

Test Steps.Step Action: If search results are paginated, use the pagination controls to navigate between pages (e.g., Next, Previous).
Test Steps.Step Expected: Pagination should work, allowing users to navigate through multiple pages of search results.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click the Manage option in the Actions menu next to any voter.
Test Steps.Step Expected: Clicking Manage opens the voter details screen for viewing voter information.

Test Steps.Step Action: Optionally, click Reset to clear all search fields.
Test Steps.Step Expected: The search form should reset, clearing all previously entered search criteria.

Title: VM - Enable Voter Communication through SMS and Email

Test Steps.Step Action: The Solution shall allow authorized users to send a text message (SMS) to voters.
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Go to Voter Management then Voter
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Voter Management page is opened

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Search/Add button
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Voter Search page is opened\nThe Add button is disabled

Test Steps.Step Action: Add the Last Name, First Name, DOB
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Add button is enabled

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Add button
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Voter Registration

Test Steps.Step Action: Complete the Voter Details
Test Steps.Step Expected: The User is able to add the Voter Details information

Test Steps.Step Action: Complete the Identification section
Test Steps.Step Expected: The User is able to add the Identification information

Test Steps.Step Action: Complete the Residential Address section
Test Steps.Step Expected: The User is able to add the Residential Address information

Test Steps.Step Action: On Contact Details select Email from Preferred Method of Contact dropdown
Test Steps.Step Expected: The User is able to select the Email option

Test Steps.Step Action: Add the Email field
Test Steps.Step Expected: The User is able to introduce the email

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Next button
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Application saves the information

Test Steps.Step Action: Reproduce step 3 - 8 and select Mobile from Preferred Method of Contact dropdown
Test Steps.Step Expected: The User is able to select the Mobile option

Test Steps.Step Action: Mark the Check to option for text Message
Test Steps.Step Expected: The user is able to mark the option

Test Steps.Step Action: Add the Mobile number
Test Steps.Step Expected: The User is able to add the Mobile number

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Next button
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Application saves the information

Title: Manage Ballots - Absentee Ballot Processing

Test Steps.Step Action: Given the user is on Landing page, VM > Voter Ballot > Manage Absentee Ballots > Absentee Ballot Processing
Test Steps.Step Expected: User should be on Absentee Ballot Records page

Test Steps.Step Action: Select an Election Date Name field value and also the Ballot status field value followed by clicking Search
Test Steps.Step Expected: System displays the buckets (number followed by date) available for the given search criteria

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on any one of the bucket
Test Steps.Step Expected: System will display the scanned ballot along with all the Voter information. And at the bottom of the screen, there are Zoom In and Zoom Out buttons

Title: VM - Ballot - Maintain Outstanding Absentee Ballots

Test Steps.Step Action: VM - Ballot - Absentee Batch Processes

Title: VM-Ballot Add/Maintain UOCAVA/E&D Status

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to the "Voter" section and search for a voter
Test Steps.Step Expected: The user is able to search and select the voter successfully.

Test Steps.Step Action: On the voter information page, verify the "Absentee" tab is visible and accessible
Test Steps.Step Expected: The "Absentee Ballot" tab is displayed and accessible.

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify the "Add/Maintain UOCAVA/Permanent Absentee Status" button is visible under the "Absentee" tab
Test Steps.Step Expected: The button is clearly labeled as "Add/Maintain UOCAVA/Permanent Absentee Status" under the "Absentee Ballot" tab.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click the "Add/Maintain UOCAVA/Permanent Absentee Status" button
Test Steps.Step Expected: The user is navigated to a dedicated page for managing absentee status.

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify the stand-alone page is displayed with the voter card at the top
Test Steps.Step Expected: The page displays the voter card at the top.

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify the input fields on the page: - Annual Absentee Status (Dropdown) - Annual Absentee Status Reason (Dropdown) - UOCAVA Start Date (Date Picker) - UOCAVA End Date (Date Picker) - Ballot Mailing Address Checkbox (Conditional) - Mail Forwarding Address (Enabled for UOCAVA/FPCA)
Test Steps.Step Expected: All input fields are displayed correctly and are functional based on selection logic.

Test Steps.Step Action: Select "UOCAVA/FPCA" and verify the options in "Annual Absentee Status Reason" dropdown
Test Steps.Step Expected: The dropdown shows only: "Citizen Residing Overseas," "Member of Uniformed Services," "Spouse/Dependent of Uniformed Services Member."

Test Steps.Step Action: Select "Annual Application" and verify the options in "Annual Absentee Status Reason" dropdown
Test Steps.Step Expected: The dropdown shows only: "65 Years of Age or Older," "Disability," "Expected to Give Birth."

Test Steps.Step Action: Select "Annual Application" and check the Ballot Mailing Address checkbox
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system autofills the ballot mailing address with the voter’s registered address and locks the fields for editing.

Test Steps.Step Action: Uncheck the Ballot Mailing Address checkbox and verify the mailing address fields are editable
Test Steps.Step Expected: The mailing address fields become editable after unchecking the checkbox.

Test Steps.Step Action: Select "UOCAVA/FPCA" and verify the Mail Forwarding Address fields are enabled
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Mail Forwarding Address fields are enabled for input when "UOCAVA/FPCA" is selected.

Test Steps.Step Action: Select UOCAVA/FPCA and verify that the "Preferred Method" dropdown displays "Mail," "Email," and "Fax"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The "Preferred Method" dropdown shows the options: Mail, Email, and Fax.

Test Steps.Step Action: Select "Annual Application" and verify that only "Mail" is available in the "Preferred Method" dropdown
Test Steps.Step Expected: The "Preferred Method" dropdown shows only "Mail."

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify error handling for missing required fields (e.g., missing status reason or start/end date)
Test Steps.Step Expected: \nAn error message is displayed indicating the missing required fields.\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify error handling if "Annual/UOCAVA End Date" is earlier than "Annual/UOCAVA Start Date"
Test Steps.Step Expected: An error message prompts the user to correct the dates.

Test Steps.Step Action: Input valid data into all required fields and click the "Save" button
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system saves the data and updates the voter’s absentee status. The user is navigated back to the voter history page.

Test Steps.Step Action: Modify the absentee status and click "Save" to update
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system reflects the updated absentee status immediately after saving.

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify that the system tracks and records changes for audit purposes
Test Steps.Step Expected: The audit logs track the changes made to the absentee status with details like the date and the user who made the changes.

Test Steps.Step Action: Simulate an error during the save/update process
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system displays a relevant error message, and no data is saved until the issue is resolved.

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify that the "Add/Maintain UOCAVA/Permanent Absentee Status" button changes to "Add/Maintain UOCAVA/Annual Absentee" after saving/updating
Test Steps.Step Expected: The button is updated to "Add/Maintain UOCAVA/Annual Absentee" after saving or updating the status.

Title: VM - Add New Voter

Test Steps.Step Action: Given user is logged in as a County user and street lookup functionality is accessible
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Search voter
Test Steps.Step Expected: User lands on the 'Voter Search'\n'Add' button is grayed out and not clickable

Test Steps.Step Action: Fill in all mandatory fields and click 'Search'
Test Steps.Step Expected: User is presented with search results\n'Add' button turns blue and is clickable

Test Steps.Step Action: Click 'Add' to add a new voter to the system
Test Steps.Step Expected: User is presented with the New Voter Registration page with required fields visible.

Test Steps.Step Action: Enter personal details such as Name, Date of Birth, US Citizen (Yes/No), and Address (Street, City, Zip Code). (Use search lookup)
Test Steps.Step Expected: All required fields must be accepted.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click the “Search Street” button to validate the address.
Test Steps.Step Expected: If the address is valid, the system should display the corresponding district and precinct details.

Test Steps.Step Action: Select the voter’s preferred language from the drop-down list (English, Spanish, Vietnamese, Mandarin, or other configurable options).
Test Steps.Step Expected: The selected language is saved and displayed in the system.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the Next button
Test Steps.Step Expected: User will be navigated to Review screen.

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify all the details on Review screen and select the NVRA Code dropdown at the bottom of the screen and click on Register Voter
Test Steps.Step Expected: User will be navigated to Final screen and voter successfully registered message will be displayed along with the entered voter information.

Test Steps.Step Action: \n
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Expected: The Voter Management page is opened

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Search/Add button
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Voter Search Page is opened

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Add buton
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Add Voter page is opened

The application displays the following message:
"Required fields missing".
Also, the application highlights in a red box the following fields:
- Source
- Gender
- Type of State ID
- US Citizen
- Street Number
- Street Name
- City
- Zip Code

Test Steps.Step Expected: The application displayes the step 2 Review Screen

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Register Voter button
Test Steps.Step Expected: The application displays a message about missing required field, and highlight the field which is:\n- NVRA Code\n

Title: VM - More than 1 signatures

Test Steps.Step Action: current and previous signatures viewable side-by-side in order of affidavits from most recent to first when requested (1) per voter record or (2) automatically displayed.

Title: Cancelled Voter

Test Steps.Step Action: Cancelled Voter
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: The Solution shall require authorized users to indicate a reason for Voter Registration Cancellation including but not limited to: Deceased, Felon, Duplicate Record, Mental Incompetence
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Precondition: There is a voter already register which status is not Cancelled
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Log in as a County user
Test Steps.Step Expected: User is logged in as a County user

Test Steps.Step Action: Select the Voter option under the Voter Management menu
Test Steps.Step Expected: User is redirected to the Voter Management screen

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Search
Test Steps.Step Expected: User is redirected to the Voter Search screen

Test Steps.Step Action: Enter the search criteria to find the voter (e.g., the voter ID, Last Name) and click on Search
Test Steps.Step Expected: Searched voter is displayed in the voter search grid

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the Actions menu of the voter and select the Update option
Test Steps.Step Expected: User is redirected to the Voter Registration screen

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the Next button at the bottom of the screen
Test Steps.Step Expected: Prompt asking for confirmation to proceed with registration is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click Yes on the Confirmation pop up to proceed with the registration process
Test Steps.Step Expected: User is redirected to the Review screen

Test Steps.Step Action: Check the Override check box next to the Status Reason field
Test Steps.Step Expected: Status and Status reason fields are enabled

Test Steps.Step Action: Enter the Status: Cancelled
Test Steps.Step Expected: Cancelled status is set in the Status field

Test Steps.Step Action: Select the Status Reason and verify Status Reason options include but are not limited to: Deceased, Felon, Duplicate Record, Mental Incompetence
Test Steps.Step Expected:
Status Reason options include: 
 Adjudged Incompetent to Vote, 
 Cancellation Due to Texas Online Change (Cancelled by State), 
Convicted Felon,
Deceased, 
Disqualified Voter, 
Duplicate Cancel with No History by County, Expired FPCA, 
Failure to Respond to Notice of Investigation, Felon,  
FPCA - Deceased, 
Created by the System to Cancel an FPCA Voter That is a Duplicate, 
Created by the User to Indicate FPCA Cancellation at the FPCA Voters Request, 
FPCA Voters Permanent Record Cancelled by Strong Matched Merge, 
An FPCA Voter Was Cancelled by Reason 18 (Felony), 
An FPCA Voter Was Canceled by Reason 20 (Mental Incompetence), 
An FPCA Voter was Cancelled by Reason 24 (Non U.S. Citizen), 
General Duplicate Cancel by State, 
Mass Purge of Suspense Voters, 
Mental Incompetence, 
Merged Record Cancellation, 
Moved Out of County, 
Cancellation Due to Notice of Non-Citizen, 
Not a Citizen, Request by Voter, 
Response to Confirmation (Indicating Voter is Out of Country), 
Suspense to Cancelled, 
Voter Cancellation Due to Death and Was Reported by DMF

Test Steps.Step Action: Enter the Status Reason: Felon
Test Steps.Step Expected: Felon is set in the Status Reason field

Test Steps.Step Action: Select a Change Reason from the Change Reason Dropdown
Test Steps.Step Expected: Change reason selected is set ton the Change Reason Dropdown

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the Update Registration button
Test Steps.Step Expected: User is redirected to the Final Screen page

Test Steps.Step Action: Wait more than one minute and click on the Refresh button in order to see the option to Print Letter enabled
Test Steps.Step Expected: Print Letter option under the Documents To Print section is enabled

Test Steps.Step Action: Check the Print Letter box
Test Steps.Step Expected: Print Letter box is selected

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the Print Now button
Test Steps.Step Expected: Notice of Cancellation Letter is generated and downloaded for the user in PDF format

Title: Underage voter

Test Steps.Step Action: Underage voter
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Expected: User is logged in as a County user

Test Steps.Step Action: \nSelect the Voter option under the Voter Management menu\n
Test Steps.Step Expected: User is redirected to the Voter Management screen

Test Steps.Step Expected: User is redirected to the Search Voter screen

Test Steps.Step Expected: Vlues are set

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the Go to Voter Search button and search for the registered voter

Title: VM - UOCOVA Voter

Title: VM - Bulk Voter Participation

Test Steps.Step Action: PreCondition:User is logged into the system.  - User has access to the Participation section. \n - The Bulk Voter Participation tab is available.
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Voter Management →  Voter Participation.
Test Steps.Step Expected: User is redirected to the Participation screen.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Bulk Voter Participation" tab.
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Bulk Voter Participation screen is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Enter valid details in mandatory fields: Election Date, Ballot Type, Ballot Status, Request Method.
Test Steps.Step Expected: User can enter details without validation errors.

Test Steps.Step Action: Enter multiple voter registration numbers in the provided fields.
Test Steps.Step Expected: User can enter multiple voter registration numbers without errors.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Insert" button.
Test Steps.Step Expected: A Message is displayed "Participation records have been successfully submitted."

Test Steps.Step Action: If any voter is inactive or does not exist, an error message is displayed.
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system displays an appropriate error message for invalid voters.                                                     1- Can not update election history details for Voter with Voter ID 150 because the voter already has voter history for this election.                                    2-Can not update election history details for Voter with Voter ID 125 because the voter does not exist or is not active.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Clear Voters" button.
Test Steps.Step Expected: All entered voter registration numbers are cleared.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the "Reset" button.
Test Steps.Step Expected: All form fields reset to their default state.

Title: VM - Duplicate Voter (Merge Voter)

Test Steps.Step Action: Preconditions:\n Login as a Region User\n Create two voters with some identical data
Test Steps.Step Expected:
These two voters will have some identical data and some that are different e.g.

Same:
- Status
- Last Name
- Party
- Phone Number

Different:
- Everything else

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Duplicate Voter
Test Steps.Step Expected: Duplicate Voter page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: From the Search Criteria dropdown select any search criteria \ne.g. "VOTER REGISTRATION #"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Option selected

Test Steps.Step Action: Enter the Voter IDs of the two Voters you created into the "Voter Registration #1" \n and "Voter Registration #2" fields and click on "SEARCH"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Compare - Duplicate Voter page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Verify the Compare - Duplicate Voter page is displayed
Test Steps.Step Expected: All identical data  will not be highlighted, and all data that is different will be highlighted

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on "MERGE"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Merged successfully message is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Voter management->Voter search Page and enter the \n Original/Retained Voter ID
Test Steps.Step Expected: Voter record must be displayed in the grid results

Test Steps.Step Action: Enter the Duplicate Voter ID
Test Steps.Step Expected: No results found message is displayed

Title: View Voting Details when Registering a Voter

Test Steps.Step Action:
Pre-conditions:
- Have an existing Region
- Have an existing voter in that Region
- Have an existing Street/Street Segment in that Region
- Have an existing District
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Log in as a Region User
Test Steps.Step Expected: Region User logged in

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to District Management > Districts > Precincts
Test Steps.Step Expected: Precincts page will be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "ADD"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Add Precinct page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Fill in all required fields
Test Steps.Step Expected: Required fields filled in

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "SAVE"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Precinct will be created

Test Steps.Step Action: In the Precinct Assignments area, click "ADD" under the Street Segments tab
Test Steps.Step Expected: Precinct Street Segment page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Select the Street name of your existing Street
Test Steps.Step Expected: Street Name selected

Test Steps.Step Action: Select the Street Segment of your existing Street
Test Steps.Step Expected: Street Segment selected

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "SAVE"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Street Segment will be assigned to the Precinct and the user is taken back to the Precinct page

Test Steps.Step Action: In the Precinct Assignments area, select the "Districts" tab and click "ADD"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Precinct District page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Select the District Type of your existing District
Test Steps.Step Expected: District Type selected

Test Steps.Step Action: Select the District name of your existing District
Test Steps.Step Expected: District name selected

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "SAVE"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The District will be assigned to the Precinct and the user will be taken back to the Precinct page

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "UPDATE"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Precinct will be successfully updated and the user is taken back to the Precinct search page

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Voter Management > Voter > Search/Add
Test Steps.Step Expected: Voter Search page is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Enter any First Name, Last Name, and Date of Birth
Test Steps.Step Expected: Details entered

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "SEARCH"
Test Steps.Step Expected: Any voters that match these details will be shown, if not a "No results found" message will be displayed. The "ADD" button will now also be enabled

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "ADD"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The user will be taken to Voter Registration page will the previous details pre-filled

Test Steps.Step Action: Fill in all other required fields
Test Steps.Step Expected: Fields filled in

Test Steps.Step Action: Under the Residential Address section, search for your existing street name
Test Steps.Step Expected: A list of results will be displayed and the precinct you created will be shown on your existing Street Segment

Test Steps.Step Action: Select your existing Street Segment
Test Steps.Step Expected: Street Segment selected

Test Steps.Step Action: In the "Street No." fields, enter a valid Street number
Test Steps.Step Expected: Street number entered

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "SUBMIT"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Voting Details area will open up below and display your existing District and Precinct

Test Steps.Step Action: Scroll down to the bottom of the page and click "NEXT"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Review Screen will be displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Scroll down to the Precinct Details Review area
Test Steps.Step Expected: Your existing District and Precinct will be displayed here also

Test Steps.Step Action: Scroll down and select an NVRA Code
Test Steps.Step Expected: NVRA Code selected

Test Steps.Step Action: Click "REGISTER VOTER"
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Final Screen is displayed

Test Steps.Step Action: Check page
Test Steps.Step Expected: Your existing Districts and Precincts will be displayed here too

Title: VM -  Voter -Add/Maintain Participation History

Test Steps.Step Action: PreCondition:User is logged in as a County user.Voter participation history feature is enabled.User has the necessary permissions to update voter records and Voter is exist.
Test Steps.Step Expected: \n

Test Steps.Step Action: Log in as a County user.
Test Steps.Step Expected: User is successfully logged in.

Test Steps.Step Action: Navigate to Voter Management → Voter.
Test Steps.Step Expected: \nUser is redirected to the Voter Management screen.\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Search in the Voter Management screen.
Test Steps.Step Expected: User is redirected to the Search Voter screen.

Test Steps.Step Action: Enter relevant search criteria (e.g., Voter ID, Name, Date of Birth) and click Search.
Test Steps.Step Expected: Matching voter records appear in the search results grid.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the Action Ellipse (⋮) next to the voter status and select Participation History.
Test Steps.Step Expected: The Participation History section expands and displays existing participation records (if any).

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Add button in the Participation History section
Test Steps.Step Expected: A form appears to enter new participation history details.

Test Steps.Step Action:
Fill in the required fields:
- Election Date- Election Name- Party- Method of Request- Ballot Sent Date- Ballot Received Date- Ballot Return Method- Ballot Status- Ballot Status Reason- Notes
Test Steps.Step Expected: User can enter data without validation errors

Test Steps.Step Action: Click Create.
Test Steps.Step Expected: A message like "Success" is displayed.New participation record is saved and displayed in the list.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on the Action Ellipse (⋮) next to an existing participation record.
Test Steps.Step Expected: \nA dropdown menu appears.\n

Test Steps.Step Action: Select the Edit option.
Test Steps.Step Expected: Modify the necessary fields (e.g., Election Date, Election Name, Party, Ballot Status). Click on Update.                                                                   The updated data is reflected in the respective fields.

Test Steps.Step Action: Select the Delete option.
Test Steps.Step Expected: A confirmation popup appears.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click ok on the popup.
Test Steps.Step Expected: The participation record is removed from the list.

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on System Management
Test Steps.Step Expected: The System displays the options related to system Management

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Notification Template
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system displays the notification template search

Test Steps.Step Action: Search by name column and complete the name with CANCELLED_REG CANC NOTICE - IOWA
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system displays the template related

Test Steps.Step Action: click on action Edit on CANCELLED_REG CANC NOTICE - IOWA template
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system displays the notification template editable

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on Preview button
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system displays the template as a PDF file in other page

Test Steps.Step Action: Click on configuration label next to the template label
Test Steps.Step Expected: The system displays the configuration template
